The 2009 film is thirty minutes long. Among the film's
stars are Kate Mulgrew, Peter Riegert, Aasif Mandvi and the film's writer Sig
Libowitz. The film was the directorial debut of writer and director Adam
Rodgers. {{cite news
| url=http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2666268/ title=Adam Rodgers publisher=IMDb arc-
| hiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.imdb.com%2Fname-
| %2Fnm2666268%2F&date=2009-09-05 archivedate=2009-09-05
}} {{cite news
| url=http://www.mlive.com/us-
| politics/index.ssf/2009/05/new_role_for_daily_show_report.html title=New role
| for 'Daily Show' reporter date=2009-05-09 author= publisher=MLive archiveurl=-

| politics%2Findex.ssf%2F2009%2F05%2Fnew_role_for_daily_show_report.html&date=2-
| 009-09-05 archivedate=2009-09-05
}} Michael Greenberger, a professor at the University of Maryland,
consulted for the film, in his capacity as a former Justice Department counter-
terrorism official. Other faculty and students at
the University of Maryland assisted in the production of the film, which was
filmed on the University of Maryland campus.

Libowitz is a film producer, who received a Comcast Leadership Scholarship to go
to law school. One of his law professors assigned his students transcripts from
Combatant Status Review Tribunals held in 2004. Libowitz decided that the
transcript was suitable to be recreated.

The film won a Silver Gavel from the American Bar Association.
